citation.article-title: Guggenheimella bovis gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from lesions of bovine dermatitis digitalis
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Guggenheimella (Gug.gen.heim.el′la. L. dim. suff. -ella; N.L. fem. n. Guggenheimella after the Swiss microbiologist Bernhard Guggenheim, for his contributions to health research).
Obligately anaerobic, mesophilic, asaccharolytic, non-motile, non-spore-forming, Gram-positive, short to coccoid rods.
Belongs to the class ‘Clostridia’ within the phylum Firmicutes.
The cell-wall diamino acid is ornithine.
The type species is Guggenheimella bovis.
